meanings.definition: To manufacture or produce in advance.
meanings.sent1: The company premanufactures the parts before assembling the final product.
meanings.sent2: It is common for factories to premanufacture components to save time during production.
meanings.sent3: The robot decided to premanufacture all the pieces for the upcoming project, just in case.
meanings.sent4: The bakery premanufactures the dough every morning, ensuring fresh pastries for customers.
meanings.sent5: By premanufacturing the materials, the construction crew was able to finish the building ahead of schedule.

meanings.definition: The act of manufacturing or producing in advance.
meanings.sent1: Premanufactures can help streamline the production process in many industries.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was attributed to its efficient premanufactures of products.
meanings.sent3: The warehouse was filled with premanufactures waiting to be assembled into final products.
meanings.sent4: The team's strategy involved careful planning of premanufactures to meet demand.
meanings.sent5: The exhibition showcased various premanufactures from different manufacturers.
